and Martin saligman were two of the founders of the positive psychology movement positive psychology is just the

people's uh sense of well-being and thriving so that's the that's a cover of
the book and the quality ities of a flow state are that time seems to stand still you're completely involved in the
activity there's almost a sense of of of ecstasy or pleasure about the thing
there's an inner Clarity and serenity now if you've ever if you do anything athletic if you do anything you

they're not unique they're not special um and what he came up with this model
and it's the on the bottom axis of skills on the vertical axis is challenge and when the
activity challenges you just at the level of your
ability and that can be as a beginner or even as a an expert you're in what he called the flow Channel if the um
activity is doesn't challenge your skills very much you're in the boredom Zone if the activity is Way Beyond your
your current skills you're in the anxiety Zone but when you're right at that optimal point of balance you're in the Channel and you get so there's a
challenge skill balance you have really clear outcomes that you're looking for you're getting immediate feedback and
